ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Gained new vocabulary and confidence in speaking
Confidence in oral skills, new vocabulary
My proficiency in French speaking and writing definitely improved with this course. I appreciated the freedom we had in class conversations and the emphasis on vocabulary.
Conversational french improved as well as my vocabulary. Learned a lot about French politics.
Conversational French skills and knowledge of France (history, geography, culture)
A greater depth of understanding of the French culture through exploration of its society today.

J'ai beaucoup profit de ce cours ! On discute des sujets trs importants en France aujourd'hui, tels que la lacit, l'ducation, et l'environnement. Aprs avoir suivi ce cours, j'ai plus de confiance en parlant de la socit franaise. Je suis plus  l'aise avec les critures en franais, et tout a est grce  de nombreuses occasions de pratiquer pendant chaque classe.
I learned about parts of French culture, society, and politics, as well as the related vocabulary, that is useful for day-to-day use in social and professional settings.
expanded my knowledge on french culture and history through various topics such as religion, family, employment, and even climate change

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Interesting and relevant topics, something for everyone, lots of opportunity to speak

Strengths: Diversity of mediums to engage with relating to content
Weaknesses: I think there could be more partner work, more communication between professor and students

Professor Schneider encourages active participation and growth in and out of the classroom. A strength was the attention she gave to putting together each reading and lesson plan under the different course themes covered on a weekly basis. There were no significant weaknesses I can readily think of.

Strengths: interesting content 
Weaknesses: a lot of vocab memorization can be tedious but useful
Too big. I didnt get as much attention as I wanted.

I enjoyed the course structure which drew upon media and films to watch as well. The only thing I think would be better to improve on the conversational aspect of the oral is to have smaller classes to enable some more actual conversation, rather than just responses.

Les discussions sont fascinantes, car on s'intresse aux sujets enseigns. J'ai lu des articles qui avaient rapport aux problmes urgents en France. On a parl des difficults et puis des solutions envisageables.

Le travail  faire pour lundi peut tre un peu excessif, car on a souvent une criture en plus des lectures. Quand mme, la charge de travail est gnralement matrisable.

The greatest weakness of the course was the in-class essays because they were supposed to be vocabulary and knowledge/expression tests at the same time. However, when you have to structure your entire answer around including the correct number of (memorized) vocabulary words, it means you are not structuring your answer based on knowledge, reasoning, or an argument.

strengths: interesting material, readings, films, VERY organized course  

weaknesses: not as many projects as I had anticipated

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, definitely!
Its one of the better French classes they offer because you get to look at French culture and media.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. The orals (2 20 minute presentations with essentially no notes) were difficult and time-consuming to prepare for, but definitely effective in improving my French proficiency.

I would recommend this as a language credit to someone already fluent in French. The actual material gets tired if you are not very interested in French politics and culture. Watching the movies was fun though!
No. There was a lot of reading.
I would, I particularly enjoyed the oral examination aspect. I also really liked the movies we studied.

Oui, je recommanderais sans doute ce cours aux autres. Si on veut bien apprendre le franais et parler la langue couramment, il est trs important de suivre le franais 160 au but d'amliorerson expression orale. De plus, le franais nest pas simplement une langue. Cest galement un patrimoine culturel et une manire de penser.  mon avis, le franais 150 est gnial et ncessaire, mais cela ne suffirait pas si on voudrait parvenir  un niveau de confiance lev avec sa connaissance du franais et de la France.
Yes, this is a good course for developing practical use of French language and engaging with different types of materials (articles, films, etc).

Yes, Professor Schneider is one of the best French teachers at Yale. She is extremely organized and WILL encourage/demand(?) that everyone participates and thus you will improve. She is caring and a sweet teacher
